title: 1 John Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 John chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 John Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 John Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:1, what has the Father bestowed upon us?
options: That we should be called the sons of God
That we should have great wealth
That we should rule the earth
That we should never face trials
questions.correctAnswer: That we should be called the sons of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:1 states that the Father has bestowed upon us the love that we should be called the sons of God.

questions.question: What will happen when He shall appear, according to 1 John 3:2?
options: We shall be like Him
We shall rule kingdoms
We shall see angels
We shall receive treasures
questions.correctAnswer: We shall be like Him
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:2 explains that when He appears, we shall be like Him because we shall see Him as He is.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:4, what is sin?
options: The transgression of the law
A natural human weakness
An unavoidable mistake
A burden from birth
questions.correctAnswer: The transgression of the law
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:4 clearly states that sin is the transgression of the law.

questions.question: Who is without sin according to 1 John 3:5?
options: He who was manifested to take away our sins
Every man who believes
The angels in heaven
The prophets
questions.correctAnswer: He who was manifested to take away our sins
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:5 states that He was manifested to take away our sins and in Him is no sin.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:7, what is true about the one who does righteousness?
options: He is righteous, even as He is righteous
He will be wealthy
He will never suffer
He will become a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: He is righteous, even as He is righteous
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:7 says that he who does righteousness is righteous just as He is righteous.

questions.question: Who is the one who commits sin said to be of, according to 1 John 3:8?
options: The devil
The world
The angels
The prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The devil
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:8 states that he who commits sin is of the devil, who has sinned from the beginning.

questions.question: What is the commandment mentioned in 1 John 3:23?
options: To believe on the name of Jesus Christ and love one another
To fast and pray daily
To build a place of worship
To give offerings regularly
questions.correctAnswer: To believe on the name of Jesus Christ and love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:23 states the commandment is that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:11, what message was heard from the beginning?
options: That we should love one another
That we should fear God
That we should give alms
That we should obey all laws
questions.correctAnswer: That we should love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:11 says the message heard from the beginning is that we should love one another.

questions.question: Who is mentioned as an example of wickedness in 1 John 3:12?
options: Cain
Abel
Judas
Pharaoh
questions.correctAnswer: Cain
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:12 mentions Cain as the one who was of that wicked one and slew his brother.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:14, how do we know we have passed from death unto life?
options: Because we love the brethren
Because we have wealth
Because we never sin
Because we obey the law
questions.correctAnswer: Because we love the brethren
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:14 states that we know we have passed from death unto life because we love the brethren.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 3:10 says that anyone who does not love his brother is not of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:10 states that he who does not love his brother is not of God.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 3:15, a murderer has eternal life abiding in him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:15 says no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 3:18 encourages love to be shown in deed and in truth, not just words or tongue.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:18 commands that love be expressed in deed and truth, not merely in words or tongue.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 John 3:16: 'Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his ______ for us.'
options: life
wealth
power
kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: life
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:16 states that we perceive the love of God because He laid down His life for us.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 John 3:17: 'But whoso hath this world's good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his ______ of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?'
options: bowels
heart
hand
eye
questions.correctAnswer: bowels
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:17 uses the word 'bowels' of compassion to describe withholding help from a brother in need.

medium.title: 1 John Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 John Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3 teach us about the nature of God's love and our identity as believers?
options: The Father has called us His children, and the world does not recognize us because it did not recognize Him.
We are strangers in the world with no real identity.
God's love is conditional based on our works.
We are only servants, not children of God.
questions.correctAnswer: The Father has called us His children, and the world does not recognize us because it did not recognize Him.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:1 states God's love is so great that He calls us His sons, and the world does not know us as it did not know Him. This affirms our identity as God's children and the world's lack of understanding of that identity.

questions.question: A fellow believer feels uncertain about their future glorification. Based on 1 John 3, what encouraging truth would you share?
options: When Christ appears, we will be like Him because we will see Him as He is.
Our future is unknown and unknowable.
We will remain imperfect until the end of time.
Only some believers will be transformed.
questions.correctAnswer: When Christ appears, we will be like Him because we will see Him as He is.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:2 teaches that although our full future state is not yet revealed, we know that when Christ appears, we shall be like Him because we will see Him as He truly is.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3, how should hope in Christ affect our personal holiness?
options: Hope in Christ purifies us as He is pure.
Hope allows us to ignore sin temporarily.
Hope is unrelated to holiness.
Hope means we do not need to change our behavior.
questions.correctAnswer: Hope in Christ purifies us as He is pure.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:3 explains that everyone who has this hope in Christ purifies himself just as Christ is pure, showing the direct connection between hope and holiness.

questions.question: What does 1 John 3 say about the relationship between sin and the law?
options: Sin is the transgression of the law.
Sin is a minor mistake, not related to law.
Law is irrelevant to sin.
Sin is only about thoughts, not actions.
questions.correctAnswer: Sin is the transgression of the law.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:4 clearly states that whoever commits sin also breaks the law, defining sin as the transgression of the law.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3 describe Jesus’ purpose in coming to earth?
options: He was manifested to take away our sins and is without sin.
He came to establish a political kingdom.
He came to judge all people immediately.
He came to teach only moral principles.
questions.correctAnswer: He was manifested to take away our sins and is without sin.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:5 teaches that Jesus was revealed to take away sins and that in Him there is no sin, emphasizing His sinlessness and redemptive purpose.

questions.question: A believer struggles with ongoing sin. According to 1 John 3, what truth might help them understand their relationship with Christ?
options: Whoever abides in Christ does not continue to sin; sinning shows a lack of true knowledge of Him.
Sinning is acceptable as long as one tries to repent later.
Christ accepts all without change.
Sin is irrelevant to one's relationship with Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever abides in Christ does not continue to sin; sinning shows a lack of true knowledge of Him.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:6 states that those who live in Christ do not keep sinning, and continuing in sin indicates they have neither seen nor known Him.

questions.question: What warning does 1 John 3 give about those who practice sin according to their spiritual origin?
options: Those who commit sin are of the devil, as he has sinned from the beginning.
Sin has no spiritual origin.
Sin is a sign of spiritual growth.
All who sin are from God.
questions.correctAnswer: Those who commit sin are of the devil, as he has sinned from the beginning.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:8 explains that sinning marks one as of the devil, who has sinned from the start, contrasting with the purpose of the Son of God to destroy the devil’s works.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3 describe the behavior of those born of God?
options: They do not commit sin because God's seed remains in them.
They occasionally sin as a normal part of life.
They are not responsible for sinning.
They sin frequently but are forgiven automatically.
questions.correctAnswer: They do not commit sin because God's seed remains in them.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:9 teaches that those born of God do not continue in sin because God’s seed remains in them, and they cannot sin as a result of their new birth.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3, what are two characteristics that distinguish the children of God from the children of the devil?
options: Doing righteousness and loving their brothers.
Being wealthy and powerful.
Attending religious services regularly.
Observing rituals and fasting.
questions.correctAnswer: Doing righteousness and loving their brothers.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:10 states that children of God are recognized by doing righteousness and loving their brothers, while those who do not are not of God.

questions.question: What example from 1 John 3 warns believers about the dangers of jealousy and hatred within the community?
options: Cain, who was of the wicked one and slew his brother because his works were evil.
Abel, who was righteous and peaceful.
Moses, who led the Israelites out of Egypt.
David, who became king of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: Cain, who was of the wicked one and slew his brother because his works were evil.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:12 uses Cain as an example of one who acted wickedly by killing his brother out of jealousy and evil works, warning believers against such hatred.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 3, hatred towards a brother is equivalent to murder and disqualifies one from eternal life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:15 clearly states that whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and no murderer has eternal life abiding in him, equating hatred with spiritual death.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3 explain the practical outworking of God's love in the life of a believer?
options: By laying down our lives for our brothers, just as Christ laid down His life for us.
By giving only words of comfort.
By avoiding difficult relationships.
By focusing only on personal salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: By laying down our lives for our brothers, just as Christ laid down His life for us.
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:16 teaches that we understand God's love because He laid down His life for us, and we are called to do the same for our brothers, showing practical sacrificial love.

questions.question: A believer has resources but ignores a brother in need. According to 1 John 3, what question should they consider about the love of God in their heart?
options: How can the love of God dwell in someone who shuts up compassion from a brother in need?
How can God bless material wealth?
How can one grow without giving?
How can prayer replace action?
questions.correctAnswer: How can the love of God dwell in someone who shuts up compassion from a brother in need?
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:17 challenges believers who have the world's goods but withhold compassion from needy brothers, questioning how God's love can truly dwell in such a person.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 1 John 3:18 calls believers to love not just in word or tongue, but in ______ and in truth.
options: deed
speech
thought
prayer
questions.correctAnswer: deed
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:18 emphasizes that love must be demonstrated by actions ('deed') and truth, not just spoken words.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 3 teaches that if our heart condemns us, we have no assurance before God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:20 shows that even if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart and knows all things, giving us assurance beyond our feelings.

hard.title: 1 John Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 John Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:1, why does the world not recognize the children of God?
options: Because the world knew not the Father
Because the children of God are invisible
Because they live separately from the world
Because they speak a different language
questions.correctAnswer: Because the world knew not the Father
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that the world knoweth us not because it knew Him not, referring to God the Father.

questions.question: What hope leads a person to purify themselves according to 1 John 3:3?
options: The hope of seeing Jesus as He is
The hope of riches and honor
The hope of eternal life alone
The hope of avoiding punishment
questions.correctAnswer: The hope of seeing Jesus as He is
questions.explanation: The hope mentioned in verse 3 is that when Jesus appears, believers shall be like Him and see Him as He is, which motivates purification.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3:4 define sin?
options: The transgression of the law
A failure to forgive others
A lack of faith in God
A punishment from God
questions.correctAnswer: The transgression of the law
questions.explanation: The verse directly defines sin as transgressing the law.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus being 'manifested' as described in 1 John 3:5?
options: He was manifested to take away sins
He was manifested to bring wealth
He was manifested to rule earthly kingdoms
He was manifested to teach the law
questions.correctAnswer: He was manifested to take away sins
questions.explanation: The verse states Jesus was manifested to take away sins, highlighting His role as Savior free from sin Himself.

questions.question: In 1 John 3:6, what is the relationship between abiding in Christ and sinning?
options: Whoever abides in Him does not sin
Whoever abides in Him sins regularly
Abiding and sinning are unrelated
Sinning is a sign of abiding in Him
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever abides in Him does not sin
questions.explanation: The verse makes a strong connection that abiding in Christ means not sinning, and sinning means not knowing Him.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:8, what was the purpose of the Son of God being manifested?
options: To destroy the works of the devil
To establish a political kingdom
To make the laws of Moses obsolete
To teach wisdom to the nations
questions.correctAnswer: To destroy the works of the devil
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that the Son of God was manifested to destroy the works of the devil.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3:9 describe the effect of being born of God on sinning?
options: He cannot sin because God's seed remains in him
He will sin more often
He must follow ritual sacrifices
He is exempt from the law
questions.correctAnswer: He cannot sin because God's seed remains in him
questions.explanation: The verse states that being born of God means the seed remains in the person, making it impossible to sin.

questions.question: What parallelism is found in 1 John 3:10 regarding the children of God and the children of the devil?
options: Children of God do righteousness; children of the devil do not and do not love brothers
Children of God are wealthy; children of the devil are poor
Children of God speak truth; children of the devil lie
Children of God sacrifice animals; children of the devil do not
questions.correctAnswer: Children of God do righteousness; children of the devil do not and do not love brothers
questions.explanation: Verse 10 contrasts the righteous deeds and love of the children of God with the unrighteousness and lack of love of the children of the devil.

questions.question: What is the typological significance of Cain in 1 John 3:12?
options: Cain represents the wicked one and the evil works opposed to righteousness
Cain is a hero of faith
Cain symbolizes the ideal brother
Cain is a lawgiver
questions.correctAnswer: Cain represents the wicked one and the evil works opposed to righteousness
questions.explanation: The verse uses Cain typologically as the one who was of the wicked one and slew his righteous brother, symbolizing evil opposed to righteousness.

questions.question: What is the cause of hatred from the world toward believers as noted in 1 John 3:13?
options: Because believers follow righteousness and God
Because believers are wealthy
Because believers isolate themselves
Because believers are politically active
questions.correctAnswer: Because believers follow righteousness and God
questions.explanation: The context of the chapter shows believers are hated because they do righteousness and are children of God, a cause of world hatred.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:14, what evidences passing from death to life?
options: Love for the brethren
Performing miracles
Observing the Sabbath
Following strict dietary laws
questions.correctAnswer: Love for the brethren
questions.explanation: The verse states that loving the brethren shows that one has passed from death to life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 John 3:15: 'Whosoever hateth his brother is a ________.'
options: murderer
sinner
liar
thief
questions.correctAnswer: murderer
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that anyone who hates his brother is a murderer.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3:16 use Jesus’ sacrifice to instruct believers?
options: We ought to lay down our lives for the brethren
We should build temples in His honor
We must preach exclusively to the Jews
We are to fast twice a week
questions.correctAnswer: We ought to lay down our lives for the brethren
questions.explanation: The verse uses Christ’s laying down His life as the ultimate example of love to motivate believers to do likewise for their brethren.

questions.question: What rhetorical device is used in 1 John 3:18 to contrast types of love?
options: Antithesis between love in word and love in deed and truth
Metaphor comparing love to fire
Simile comparing love to a river
Hyperbole exaggerating love’s power
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis between love in word and love in deed and truth
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts (antithesis) loving in word or tongue with loving in deed and truth, emphasizing authentic love.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 3:22, we receive whatever we ask from God only if we keep His commandments and do what pleases Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that receiving from God is conditioned on keeping His commandments and doing what pleases Him.

theological.title: 1 John Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 John Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:1, why does the world not recognize the children of God?
options: Because the world did not know Him
Because they are too few in number
Because they do not follow the law
Because they are physically different
questions.correctAnswer: Because the world did not know Him
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:1 states the world knows us not because it knew Him not, reflecting the spiritual alienation between God's children and the world. This is consistent with John 15:18-19 and John 17:14 where Jesus explains the world's hatred and lack of recognition for His followers.

questions.question: What hope motivates believers to purify themselves according to 1 John 3:3?
options: That we shall be like Him when He appears
That we will gain wealth and prosperity
That we will avoid all suffering
That we will be accepted by the world
questions.correctAnswer: That we shall be like Him when He appears
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:3 teaches that the hope of being like Christ at His appearing motivates purification, aligning with Romans 8:29 and Philippians 3:20-21, which speak of believers being transformed into Christ's likeness.

questions.question: What is sin defined as in 1 John 3:4?
options: The transgression of the law
A mistake that can be forgiven
A weakness of the flesh
An unavoidable human condition
questions.correctAnswer: The transgression of the law
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:4 explicitly defines sin as the transgression of the law, consistent with Romans 3:20 and James 2:10 which affirm sin is violating God's law.

questions.question: What purpose did Jesus' manifestation serve according to 1 John 3:5?
options: To take away our sins
To establish a new law
To judge the world immediately
To reveal the secrets of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: To take away our sins
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:5 states Jesus was manifested to take away sins, consistent with Hebrews 9:26 and 1 Peter 2:24 that emphasize Christ's redemptive purpose.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:6, what characterizes those who abide in Christ?
options: They do not continue in sin
They are exempt from trials
They always speak in tongues
They live without faith
questions.correctAnswer: They do not continue in sin
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:6 says he who abides in Christ does not sin, affirming the transformative power of union with Christ as taught also in Romans 6:1-14 and Colossians 3:3-4.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3:7 describe the one who practices righteousness?
options: As righteous just as Christ is righteous
As a perfect and sinless person
As someone who avoids all conflicts
As a person favored by the world
questions.correctAnswer: As righteous just as Christ is righteous
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:7 states that practicing righteousness identifies one as righteous like Christ, reflecting the doctrine of imputed righteousness found in 2 Corinthians 5:21 and Philippians 3:9.

questions.question: What is the relationship between sin and the devil according to 1 John 3:8?
options: The one who sins is of the devil, who has sinned from the beginning
Sin is unrelated to the devil
The devil only tempts but does not cause sin
Sin is a necessary part of human nature
questions.correctAnswer: The one who sins is of the devil, who has sinned from the beginning
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:8 clearly links sin to the devil, indicating that those who sin belong to him, consistent with John 8:44 and Ephesians 2:2 where Satan is described as the originator of sin and evil.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:9, why does a person born of God not continue to sin?
options: Because God's seed remains in him, making him unable to sin
Because he is perfect and never falls
Because he avoids all temptation
Because sin is no longer defined for him
questions.correctAnswer: Because God's seed remains in him, making him unable to sin
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:9 states a child of God does not sin because God's seed remains in him, illustrating the new nature given at regeneration as seen also in John 1:13 and 2 Corinthians 5:17.

questions.question: What two groups are contrasted in 1 John 3:10?
options: Children of God and children of the devil
Believers and unbelievers
Rich and poor
Jews and Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Children of God and children of the devil
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:10 contrasts children of God and children of the devil based on righteousness and love, paralleling themes in John 8:44 and Matthew 7:16-20 about true identity revealed by deeds.

questions.question: What is the fundamental message believers have heard from the beginning according to 1 John 3:11?
options: That we should love one another
That we must obey the law perfectly
That wealth is a sign of blessing
That judgment is immediate
questions.correctAnswer: That we should love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:11 declares the foundational message to love one another, consistent with Jesus' teaching in John 13:34-35 and the Old Testament command in Leviticus 19:18.

questions.question: Why did Cain kill his brother according to 1 John 3:12?
options: Because his own works were evil and his brother's righteous
Because of a land dispute
Because of jealousy over possessions
Because of a misunderstanding
questions.correctAnswer: Because his own works were evil and his brother's righteous
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:12 explains Cain's motive was his evil works contrasted with Abel's righteousness, reflecting the Genesis 4 account and illustrating the conflict between good and evil.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:14, what evidence demonstrates that believers have passed from death to life?
options: Because we love the brethren
Because we never sin
Because we have wealth and success
Because we attend church regularly
questions.correctAnswer: Because we love the brethren
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:14 teaches that love for fellow believers is proof of spiritual life, consistent with John 5:24, Romans 6:23, and Galatians 5:14 emphasizing love as fruit of new life in Christ.

questions.question: How does 1 John 3:15 equate hatred with murder?
options: Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and no murderer has eternal life abiding in him
Hatred is less serious than murder
Hatred is an emotion, not a sin
Hatred is necessary for justice
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and no murderer has eternal life abiding in him
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:15 equates hatred with murder in a moral sense, emphasizing the seriousness of hatred, consistent with Jesus’ teaching in Matthew 5:21-22 and the broader biblical condemnation of hatred.

questions.question: What example of love does 1 John 3:16 provide for believers to follow?
options: Laying down one's life for the brethren
Giving large offerings
Preaching to many people
Observing religious rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Laying down one's life for the brethren
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:16 presents Christ's sacrificial death as the supreme example of love believers ought to emulate, aligning with John 15:13 and Romans 5:8 which highlight sacrificial love.

questions.question: According to 1 John 3:24, how is the presence of the Spirit in believers described?
options: As the evidence that He abides in us
As a temporary visitor
As a force that compels fear
As a gift only for apostles
questions.correctAnswer: As the evidence that He abides in us
questions.explanation: 1 John 3:24 states the Spirit given to us is the evidence that God abides in believers, consistent with Romans 8:9-11 and John 14:16-17 describing the indwelling Spirit as a seal and guarantee of salvation.
